thread.title: Northern Lebanon football team forfeits two games
thread.title_full: Northern Lebanon football team forfeits two games

title: Northern Lebanon football team forfeits two games
text:
Northern Lebanon football team forfeits two games 
Updated: 
By: CBS 21 Web Staff BETHEL TOWNSHIP, Pa. -- A once undefeated high school football team has been forced to forfeit two of its wins because of an ineligible player. 
Northern Lebanon School District said it self-reported the issue. 
The district said a player did not meet academic requirements, and the school was forced to forfeit their first two games. 
Northern Lebanon's wins over Pine Grove and Lebanon are now marked as losses.Dr. Don Bell, superintendent of Northern Lebanon School District, said, "The Northern Lebanon School District is committed to maintaining the highest ethical standards for our athletic programs. Our main goal as a school district and athletic department is to make sure all our student/athletes are prepared academically and athletically."The Vikings record stands at 5-2.
